Otsubone (court lady) of Nihongi (Six National Histories)

sen.j: 『源氏物語』を女房に読ませて聞いた一条天皇が作者を褒めて、きっと日本紀（日本紀は『続日本紀』によれば『日本書紀』のことであるので『日本書紀』をさすという説がある）をよく読みこんでいる人に違いないと言った。
sen.e: Ichijo Emperor had a court lady read aloud "The Tale of Genji," and praised the author saying that she must have read eagerly Nihongi. (According to "Shoku Nihongi (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan)," Nihongi refers to "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)," so some people claim that "Nihongi" in this context means "Nihonshoki.")
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Emperor Ichijo had a court lady read aloud "The Tale of Genji," and praised the author, saying that she must have read eagerly Nihongi (according to "Shoku Nihongi (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan)," Nihongi refers to "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)," so some people claim that "Nihongi" in this context means "Nihonshoki").

Emperor Ichijo had a court lady read aloud "The Tale of Genji," at which he praised the author, saying she must have been an eager reader of Nihongi (according to "Shoku-Nihongi (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan)," whereby Nihongi refers to "Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)"; thus some people claim that "Nihongi" in this context means "Nihonshoki").

sen.j: このことから、「日本紀の御局」とあだ名されたとの逸話があるが、これには女性が漢文を読むことへの揶揄があり、本人には苦痛だったようであるとする説が通説である。
sen.e: Because of this, Murasaki Shikibu was given a nickname of 'Nihongi no Otsubone,' but it is widely thought that Emperor's words brought her into ridicule that woman shouldn't read Chinese classics, and she was distressed by the words.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の公家系譜の集大成である『尊卑分脈』（『新編纂図本朝尊卑分脉系譜雑類要集』）になると、「上東門院女房 歌人 紫式部是也 源氏物語作者 或本雅正女云々 為時妹也云々 御堂関白道長妾」と紫式部の項にはっきり道長妾との註記が付くようになるが、彼女と道長の関係は不明である。
sen.e: Also, "Japanese Various Families' Trees" ("New Compilation of Japanese Various Families' Trees Analogy") says that 'A court lady of Jotomonin, poet, Murasaki Shikibu, an author of The Tale of Genji, or Masatada's granddaughter, Tametoki's daughter, mistress of Michinaga, the chief adviser to the Emperor,' which shows clearly that she was a mistress of Michinaga, but true relationship between them is unknown.

sen.j: 紫式部学会とは、1932年（昭和7年）6月4日に、東京帝国大学文学部国文学科主任教授であった藤村作（会長）、東京帝国大学文学部国文学科教授であった久松潜一（副会長）、東京帝国大学文学部国文学研究室副手であった池田亀鑑（理事長）らによって源氏物語に代表される古典文学の啓蒙を目的として設立された学会である。
sen.e: The purpose of Academy of Murasaki Shikibu is to promote classical literature represented by The Tale of Genji, and the academy was established on June 4 1932 by Tsukuru FUJIMURA (president), who was a head of Department of Japanese literature, Faculty of Letters at Tokyo Imperial University, and Senichi HISAMATSU (vice president), a professor of Japanese literature at Tokyo Imperial University, and Kikan IKEDA (chairperson), a junior assistant of the Japanese literature study room in Tokyo Imperial University.
